It has ever been free to all, without dis- tinction, to sell as well as to drink this much spoken of herb. There is no part of the year that the Spaniards do not despatch to the cities of CorrienteS, Santa Fe, and Buenos-Ayres, many thousand pounds of it, thence to be transported, in huge vessels, to the different ports of Tucu- man, Peru, and Chili, not one of the Jesuits daring to arrogate the right of opposing them. The Indian Guaranies, inhabitants of the thirty- two Reductions which were under our adminis- tration, only make the herb caci-miri, selling it for the use of the higher orders.
